column4: when trying to install libldap2-dev with Synaptic, it says   "Depends: libldap-2.4-2 (=2.4.23-0ubuntu3.5) but 2.4.23-0ubuntu3.6 is to be installed". However, it's installed!
there's an upgrade that supercedes 2.4.23-0ubuntu3.5
i.e. the latest is 2.4.23-0ubuntu3.6 therefore the package manager is installing that
but synaptic shows that I have 2.4.23-0ubuntu3.6
***READ*** the statements
EvilResistance:?
"Depends: libldap-2.4-2 (=2.4.23-0ubuntu3.5)"  Is 2.4.23-0ubuntu3.5 equal to 2.4.23-0ubuntu3.6
so I should downgrade it?
either that or not use what you're trying to install.
or file a bug against what you're trying to install saying they should update their package(s)
i rarely recommend downgrading anything
what package are you trying to install?
it's Libreoffice. How can I downgrade it?
that should have already been installed *runs tests*  what distro?  11.04, 11.10?
I have 10.10 on powerpc. 11.04 is slow and 11.10 has booting problems
ah.
i'm not sure i'll be able to assist - i'm on 11.04 + KDE
but you now know the issue
sure. So it's impossible to install libreoffice on 10.10?
Thanks, anyway.
